## [Benefits of Studying at SARA]{.theme-white} {.scrollable background-image=images/lavender.png background-size=cover}

<!-- {visibility="hidden"} -->

<br>

::: {.panel-tabset}

### For $12^{th}$ class

- We offer 45 days [Basics of Computer]{.rainbow-purple} course to improve the computer friendliness of students from semi-urban and rural regions.

- We offer regular [English language]{.rainbow-purple} classes to improve writing, listening & speaking skills.

- We [mentor]{.rainbow-purple} students to get admission in prestigious national and international universities.

### For UG & PG

- Using [R programming language](https://www.r-project.org/) & [GitHub](https://github.com/), we offer various data science courses to teach data visualization, wrangling, statistics, and communication (like creating website using [Quarto](https://quarto.org/)).

- All UG & PG students can also attend our English & Computer courses to improve their basics.

- We can mentor UG & PG students to create an unique online profile to get [scholarship]{.rainbow-purple} for further studies or to get [job]{.rainbow-purple} in industry.

### For PhD Scholars & Faculty {.scrollable}

- Data science plays a crucial role in [research]{.rainbow-purple} across various fields due to its ability to analyze, interpret, and derive insights from large and complex data sets.

- We offer data science, research methodology, and statistics workshop and [summer/winter school]{.rainbow-purple} for PhD scholars and Faculty.

::: {.scrollable}

- Here are some key areas where data science is used in research: 
  - Healthcare and Medicine  
  - Social Sciences
  - Environmental Science
  - Business and Marketing
  - Engineering and Technology
  - Education
  - Astronomy and Astrophysics
  - Psychology and Neuroscience
  - Agriculture
  - Energy
  
:::  

:::

## [SARA Summer School Courses]{.theme-white} {background-image="images/lemon.png" background-size=cover .scrollable}

<br>

**5 days courses (9 am to 12:30 pm & 1:30 pm to 6 pm; 40 hours).**

**22-26 July 2024**

- [**Day 1 (22 July): Introduction to data science**]{.rainbow-purple}
    
    - *Online Expert lecture*
    - R & RStudio
    - Types of operators
    - RStudio project
    - Coding using console, script & quarto
    - Structure of R function
    - R packages
    - Create objects
    - Communicate using quarto
    - Help from R community

- [**Day 2 (23 July): Data Visualization**]{.rainbow-purple}

    - *Online Expert lecture*
    - Introduction & first steps
    - ggplot2 calls
    - Visualizing distributions
    - Visualizing relationships
    - Saving your plots
    - Common problems

- [**Day 3 (24 July): Research Design in Social Sciences**]{.rainbow-purple}

    - *Online Expert lecture*
    - Research framework
    - Research approaches
    - Ethics in research
    - Literature review and its tools
    - Levels of measurement
    - Sampling and its types
    - Quantiative methods and analysis
    - Qualitative methods and analysis

- [**Day 4 (25 July): Quantitative Data Analysis**]{.rainbow-purple}

    - *Online Expert lecture*
    - Data and table manners
    - Average and percentiles
    - Spreads
    - Transforming data
    - The normal distribution
    - From samples to populations
    - Getting confident
    - Fun with proportions
    - Correlation and regression

- [**Day 5 (26 July): Publish using R and GitHub**]{.rainbow-purple}

    - *Online Expert lecture*
    - Reproducible research
    - Dynamic thesis, articles and slides.
    - Add links and images
    - Prepare list
    - Write equations
    - Prepare tables
    - Reference management
    - Learn using GitHub
    - Make your own website
